We cannot separately identify the impact of selection effects versus other channels through which ownership affects treatment decisions. However, while selection effects and reimbursement incentives may appear to be distinct theories of physician behavior, they are closely related. Analogous to genotypeenvironment interactions in biology, physician Ã¢â¬ÅgreedÃ¢â¬Â is a genotype that manifests itself under reimbursement schemes that require physicians to trade off patient and personal welfare.
